intro: Theana vietnamica, commonly known as the Vietnamese theana, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Vietnam. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, humid environments, often in forest understories. Its leaves are elliptical, glossy, and have a slightly serrated edge. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered an endangered species.
